meanings.definition: Walk or move wearily or reluctantly.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she traipses home, exhausted.
meanings.sent2: He traipses slowly up the steep hill, dragging his feet.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy traipses back to its bed, ready for a nap.
meanings.sent4: She traipses through the week, each day feeling heavier than the last.
meanings.sent5: The old man traipses through the memories of his youth, each step a struggle.

meanings.definition: To walk or move aimlessly or idly.
meanings.sent1: The children traipses around the playground, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: She traipses through the park, enjoying the sunshine and fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The cat traipses around the house, chasing imaginary mice.
meanings.sent4: He traipses through life, never settling in one place for too long.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly traipses from flower to flower, spreading beauty wherever it goes.
